lines.text: So, remote work has really changed how I think about office hours.
Yeah, I don't miss commuting at all.
It’s still weird to be eating breakfast on a video call though.
Right? And time zones can make calls so early or late.
Absolutely. Without boundaries, work creeps into everything.
I started putting my laptop away at 6 pm.
Our team set 'no meeting' days too.
Same, we even have a meeting-free Friday.
In others, staying late is seen as dedication.

cutins.prompt: Share a thought or question about balancing work and life without derailing the flow.

choices.text: Exactly! Do you set boundaries to avoid working late at home?
I love working from home, I can stay in pajamas.
Working remote is terrible, we should go back to the office.
I'm thinking about changing jobs because of remote work.

cutins.prompt: Take the discussion deeper into culture or values.

choices.text: Do you think different cultures handle work‑life balance differently?
It sounds like fairness and respect for personal time is key—what’s something that helps in your country?
Work-life balance doesn't matter; we should just work harder.
By the way, I had brunch last weekend.
